intro: Anthospermum madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Anthospermum madagascariense thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
